result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen G. Baxter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.  Successfully complete Behavioral Health Treatment Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen G. Baxter

records.addlTxt: Deceased.
1 yr probation.
received from Janell Nehring @ DOC
Minutes of 7/23/15 corrected as DE was placed on probation for 1 year and not 2 years.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
DE enters into Behavioral Health Court

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Stephen G. Baxter, appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  DE enters into Behavioral Health Court and sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 years with conditions.  Credit for 87 days if revoked.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
Plea hearing on July 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Plea Hearing scheduled 7/23/15 at 3:30 PM and confirmed with Atty DeFilippis

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis states the deft has been accepted into the behavioral health treatment court.  Hearing to be scheduled in Br 8.  Bond continued.
Per Atty DeFilippis the case is going to be resolved  as the deft will be taking advantage of the State's offer for BHTC; set for PLEAS on 7/16/15 at 2pm.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 8/27/15 at 1:15pm and JS 9/14/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
